metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7960 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
The cr_input_new_from_uri function in cr-input.c in libcroco 0.6.11 and 0.6.12 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read) via a crafted CSS file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7960` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcroco-tools - 0.6.13-1
libcroco3 - 0.6.13-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libcroco package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.6.13-1').
